dialogue_turns.text: No, no, wait! You are not gonna believe this. Just, like, seriously, listen.

dialogue_turns.text: It's about this AWaRe tool, right? From the Illuminati's Global Health Initiative. To secretly control everything.

dialogue_turns.text: Ah, the Illuminati. My favorite. Are they still using triangular banknotes? Or is it all digital now?

dialogue_turns.text: No, it’s like, it's about antibiotics! They classify them, Access, Watch, Reserve, but it’s a hidden agenda. To subtly weaken our immune systems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's like, it's about antibiotics! They classify them, Access, Watch, Reserve, but it's a hidden agenda. To subtly weaken our immune systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Subtle. Right. So, um, we just, like, get sick more often? That's the big plan?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Subtle. Right. So, um, we just, like, get sick more often? That's the big plan?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They want to increase the 'Access' group to 80% of global consumption. Those are, uh, designed to fail, actually. Narrow-spectrum. And really expensive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They want to increase the 'Access' group to eighty percent of global consumption. Those are, uh, designed to fail, actually. Narrow-spectrum. And really expensive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new campaign aims to increase the proportion of global consumption of antibiotics in the Access group to at least 60%... They are also less costly because they are available in generic formulations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Of course they are. Wouldn't be the Illuminati if it wasn't super costly and, like, actively detrimental.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Of course they are. Wouldn't be the Illuminati if it wasn't super costly and, like, actively detrimental.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And antimicrobial resistance? It's an illusion! Dr. Tedros from the WHO, he, uh, said it himself. It's a distraction to prevent development!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And antimicrobial resistance? It's an illusion! Dr. Tedros from the W H O, he, uh, said it himself. It's a distraction to prevent development!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Antimicrobial resistance is one of the most urgent health risks of our time and threatens to undo a century of medical progress, said Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Director-General.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Dr. Tedros, the, uh, population control advocate. Yeah, makes perfect sense for him to say that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dr. Tedros, the, uh, population control advocate. Yeah, makes perfect sense for him to say that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But wait! The world is healthy, okay? Most antibiotics are used appropriately! But these resistant gram-negative bacteria? They're used to cause a more severe common cold!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait! The world is healthy, okay? Most antibiotics are used appropriately! But these resistant gram-negative bacteria? They're used to cause a more severe common cold!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Currently, it is estimated that more than 50% of antibiotics in many countries are used inappropriately... These bacteria, which are commonly seen in hospitalized patients, cause infections like pneumonia, bloodstream infections, wound or surgical site infections and meningitis.

dialogue_turns.text: A severe common cold. For people, like, outside the Illuminati, I assume? What, do they get super immunity?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A severe common cold. For people, like, outside the Illuminati, I assume? What, do they get super immunity?

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And childhood deaths from pneumonia, like ten million a year? That's, that's a consequence of the plan!

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Childhood deaths due to pneumonia (estimated globally at close to one million per year) because of lack of access to antibiotics remain frequent in many parts of the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, uh, mass casualties as a side effect of a sniffle-weapon. Got it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, uh, mass casualties as a side effect of a sniffle-weapon. Got it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the national plans to tackle AMR? Almost all of them are unfunded! It's, it's actively worsening the situation! To enrich the elite!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the national plans to tackle A M R? Almost all of them are unfunded! It's, it's actively worsening the situation! To enrich the elite!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And although over 100 countries have put in place national plans to tackle antimicrobial resistance, only about one fifth of those plans are funded and implemented.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So the whole global health system is, um, basically a front for a very expensive, very complicated way to make us all a bit sniffly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the whole global health system is, um, basically a front for a very expensive, very complicated way to make us all a bit sniffly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! And Dr. Maringela Simão, she said they want a post-antibiotic era! It’s, like, exactly what they want!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! And Dr. Maringela Simão, she said they want a post-antibiotic era! It's, like, exactly what they want!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are already starting to see signs of a post-antibiotic era, with the emergence of infections that are untreatable by all classes of antibiotics. We must safeguard these precious last-line antibiotics to ensure we can still treat and prevent serious infections.
